cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north and then northeast, passing near Bermuda before recurving into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall forecast; closest approach expected near Bermuda

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and the Puerto Rico coast will experience long-period swells and dangerous surf
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (San Juan not listed in advisory wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at San Juan, PR
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only elevated surf along north-facing beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated showers possible; widespread heavy rainfall not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf may disrupt port small-craft operations
